column4: I am setting up another box, and just needed a reminder on how to get my X300 ATI card to have accelleration. maybe ubotu will answer me even. :p
ok I remember I can install xorg-driver-fglrx but that is a dated driver is there a better way to get accelleration on my ATI X300?
I did I used the line I used in Gentoo but it does not work.
I don't see any gtk stuff that says -dev??
You can use ssh for command line access or vnc for GUI access.
Neither of those come with windows by default, though. You'd need to downlaod 'em.
I have used VNC before does the job well, but sometimes I am not at a computer that I have rights to install to. hmmm no apps that will work without a windows side install?
forward ssh, then tunnel VNC through ssh.
